channel.title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Best Google Pixel Phones of 2025, Tested and Reviewed: Which Model to Buy, Cases and Accessories, Feature Drops
item.description: Here’s a guide to all the models—plus Pixel case recommendations and smart software tricks to try.

item.title: TikTok denies India comeback after reports of website going live
item.description: TikTok isn’t making a comeback in India.

item.title: At This Point, It’s Impossible to Know What the Trump Phone Looks Like
item.description: Despite accepting preorders and promising that “the wait is almost over,” Trump Mobile doesn’t seem any closer to proving the T1 Phone actually exists...

item.title: US government plans to take a 10% stake in Intel
item.description: Such federal government ownership of a major corporation would mark a dramatic departure from long-standing U.S. policy.

item.title: Join Our Next Livestream: Back to School in the Age of AI
item.description: Bring your stories and questions on August 28 as we explore our latest investigations into how tech is shaping education today.

item.title: Y Combinator says Apple’s App Store has hindered startup growth
item.description: Y Combinator is asking the court to deny Apple’s appeal.

item.title: The Best Big Screen Chromebook Is On Sale Now
item.description: A discount on the Asus CX15 Chromebook brings the price down to just $159.

item.title: Apple is in talks to use Google’s Gemini for Siri revamp, report says
item.description: Apple promised a major revamp to Siri, but the company's AI capabilities have lagged behind competitors.

item.title: The next Starship flight will test much more than hardware
item.description: The 10th Starship flight test will be a referendum on the company's build-fly-fix approach.

item.title: Astronomer’s New CEO Speaks—Yes, About That
item.description: The viral kiss-cam moment could be the best thing that’s ever happened to Astronomer. But its new CEO won’t say that.
